title: Graphs of relationship between a and x in SHM

content.question: An object undergoes simple harmonic motion along the x-axis shown above, where x = 0 is the object’s equilibrium position. Which of the following graphs best shows the relationship between the object’s acceleration a and its displacement x from equilibrium? (Assume positive a to be acceleration directed to the right.)

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. Choice A shows a straight line that starts in the fourth quadrant and decreases linearly, passing through the origin and ending in the second quadrant.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. Choice B shows a straight line that starts in the third quadrant and increases linearly, passing through the origin and ending in the first quadrant.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. Choice C shows a line that starts in the fourth quadrant and decreases linearly until reaching the origin, at which point it becomes linearly increasing into the first quadrant.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. Choice D shows a curve that starts in the fourth quadrant decreasing and concave up until reaching a minimum at the origin, then becomes increasing and concave up in the first quadrant.

Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. Choice E shows a curve that starts on the horizontal axis to the left of the origin and is increasing and concave down, reaches a maximum on the vertical axis, and then becomes decreasing and concave down, ending on the horizontal axis to the right of the origin.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. Each is a graph with a on the vertical axis and x on the horizontal axis. Choice A shows a straight line that starts in the fourth quadrant and decreases linearly, passing through the origin and ending in the second quadrant.
